section.p: If a terminology list has been created by another user, you must import it to make it available in .

ul.li: To import a new terms list, the New Terms Lists window must be active.
To import a found terms list, the Found Terms Lists window must be active.
To import an exclusion list, the Exclusion Lists window must be active.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p: Select Importâ€¦ from the File menu.
For an exclusion list, the Import Exclusion List window is displayed (see ). windowsImport Exclusion List Import Exclusion List windowFigure shows Import Exclusion List window

section.title: Options and parameters
section.p: Depending on the format selected, this window offers a different number of options and parameters:
For importing in format, specify the following:

plentry.pd:
Select the drive from which you want to import the terminology list.
When you have selected a drive the terminology lists are automatically displayed in the list box. Select the list you want to import.
Type the name under which you want the data stored in .

section.p: For importing in external format, specify the following:

plentry.pd:
needs information where the terminology list to be imported currently resides:
Select the drive where the external list is stored.
Name Type the name of the external list. Current directory Displays the directory selected from the Directories list box. Directories Select the directory containing the external terminology list from the list of directories on the selected drive. Files Select the file name of the external terminology list from the list of names in the currently selected path.
Type the name under which you want the data stored in .

section.p: To start the importing function, select the Import button.

section.title: Results
section.p: The terminology list is stored in and can be used for further processing.
